articles.description: Man City and Arsenal prepare for Community Shield at Wembley on Sunday, EFL and Scottish football returns, plus the latest transfer news and gossip.
articles.title: Transfers latest and weekend football build-up

articles.description: Watch live coverage from the second day of the 2023 Cycling World Championships in Glasgow.
articles.title: Watch: 2023 Cycling World Championships

articles.description: Chelsea confirm capture of France defender Axel Disasi from Monaco on a six-year contract for 45m Euros (£38.57m).
articles.title: Chelsea sign France international Disasi for £38.57m

articles.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says Croatia defender Josko Gvardiol is having a medical and will complete his switch from RB Leipzig 'in the next hours'.
articles.title: Gvardiol deal to be done 'in the next hours' - Guardiola

articles.description: Watch 10 of the best goals from the group stages of the 2023 Women's World Cup, featuring strikes from England's Lauren James, Colombia's Linda Caicedo and Marta Cox from Panama.
articles.title: James & Caicedo star in best goals of group stage

articles.description: BBC Sport takes a look at the main things to come out of a thrilling group stage at the Women's World Cup in Australia and New Zealand.
articles.title: What we learned from the World Cup group stages

articles.description: England batter and T20 World Cup winner Alex Hales announces his retirement from international cricket.
articles.title: Hales retires from international cricket

articles.description: Scottish football's ability to evoke embarrassment and rage, pride and joy endures - and we're glad it's back, writes Tom English.
articles.title: Essential guide to new Scottish Premiership season

articles.description: Watch the best moments from day three of The Hundred 2023, including a ramp six from Birmingham Phoenix's Ben Duckett and a stunning catch by Northern Superchargers bowler Georgia Wareham.
articles.title: Duckett ramps it up on Hundred return - plays of the day

articles.description: Goalkeeper Mary Earps says England "do not fear anyone" at the Women's World Cup as they prepare for their last-16 tie with Nigeria.
articles.title: England don't fear anyone at World Cup - Earps
